storyTitle: As End User, I want to input my username to achieve identification for authentication

functional.title: Verify username input field displays with correct label and placeholder text
preconditions: User has a modern web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) installed
Application login page URL is accessible
No active user session exists (user is logged out)
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the login page by entering the application URL in the browser
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully and displays the login form

steps.action: Locate the username input field on the login form
steps.expectedResult: Username input field is visible and properly rendered

steps.action: Verify the label text above or adjacent to the username input field
steps.expectedResult: Label displays exactly 'Username' in clear, readable text

steps.action: Click inside the username input field to focus it
steps.expectedResult: Placeholder text 'Enter your username' is visible in light gray text inside the field

steps.action: Begin typing any character in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Placeholder text disappears and typed characters appear in the field

postconditions: Username input field remains in focused state
Login form is ready to accept username input
No error messages are displayed

testCases.title: Verify keyboard navigation and screen reader support for username input

userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND:
Users need to provide their username as the primary identifier during login to access the system securely.

CURRENT STATE:
Currently, there is no interface allowing users to input their username, preventing authentication.

DESIRED STATE:
Users can enter their username easily and accurately through a dedicated input field.

KEY FUNCTIONALITY:
• Display a clearly labeled username input field
• Support placeholder text to guide input
• Allow keyboard and screen reader accessibility
• Validate non-empty input before submission

USER INTERACTION FLOW:
1. User navigates to the login page
2. User locates the username input field
3. User enters their username
4. System validates that the field is not empty
5. User proceeds to enter password
6. User submits the login form

TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS:
• Data source: Frontend form input
• Validation rules: Non-empty, no special characters
• API endpoints: N/A for input
• Security: Input sanitization to prevent injection
• Performance: Instant client-side validation

OUT OF SCOPE:
• Password input and validation
• Backend authentication processing

SUCCESS METRICS:
• 100% of login forms display username input
• 95% reduction in empty username submissions
• Accessibility compliance with WCAG 2.1 standards
acceptanceCriteria: System displays a username input field with label 'Username' and placeholder 'Enter your username'
System prevents form submission if the username field is empty and shows inline error 'Username is required'
System supports keyboard navigation and screen reader announcements for the username field
System sanitizes username input to prevent injection attacks
